title: What's the difference between %ul and %lu C format specifiers? - Stack Overflow
text: In an example of "C Primer Plus", the author has used %ul format specifier (in both scanf and printf) for unsigned long. When I try to generalize the problem, it seems that the %ul makes something wrong in my computer. But using %lu solved the issue. Actually, rather than focusing on the problem and the line of codes, I want to know about the difference between %ul and %lu . Maybe I could figure out what's wrong. Searching doesn't give me something useful (except that "they are different"). Any explanation or link/reference is appreciated.
